basic.description: An in-depth study of Pirandello's most important plays, and an analysis of his theoretical essays on theatre. Particular attention will be paid to the following plays: Six Characters in Search of an Author; Each in his Own Way, Henry IV, The Feast of Our Lord of the Ships, Tonight We Improvise and The Mountain Giants. NOTE    Taught in English together with LLCU 257/3.0. Written work and exams are in Italian. Readings in translation.
basic.subject: ITLN
basic.title: Pirandello's Theatre
